text: The Vasco da Gama Garden (; ) is a garden in São Lázaro, Macau, China. ==History== The garden was created in the 19th century in Portuguese Macau. Along with Victory Garden, the Vasco da Gama Garden was part of the Vasco da Gama avenue built in 1898. In 1911, the bust of Vasco da Gama was erected. ==Geology== The garden spans over an area of . ==Architecture== The garden features a wave-shaped lake on the lower level of the garden and a fountain with waterspouts. ==See also== * List of tourist attractions in Macau ==References== Category:Urban public parks and gardens in Macau
title: Vasco da Gama Garden
